edu.mines.jtk.interp

Class LasserreVolume

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mines.jtk.interp.LasserreVolume

  • public class LasserreVolume
extends java.lang.Object
    Volume of an n-dimensional convex polytope, via Lasserre's algorithm. The n-dimensional (nD) polytope is specified as the intersection of at least n+1 half-spaces. A 1D polytope is a line segment defined by two intersecting half-lines (or rays); a 2D polytope is a polygon defined by at least three intersecting half-planes, a 3D polytope is a polyhedron defined by at least four intersecting half-spaces, and so on.

    Each nD half-space is represented by an inequality of the form a1*x1 + a2*x2 + ... + an*xn <= b. For example, in 2D, each half-space is defined by coefficients a1, a2 and b, and at least three such half-spaces are required to define a bounded polygon. This class computes the area of such a polygon or, more generally, the volume of an nD polytope, using Lasserre's recursive algorithm.

    This implementation currently assumes that the half-planes for any redundant half-spaces are not parallel. This assumption is and (the computed volume) is valid if each specified half-plane represents part of the boundary of a strictly convex polytope. In particular, this assumption is valid for any Voronoi polytope.

    See Lasserre J.B., 1983, An analytical expression and an algorithm for the volume of a convex polyhedron in R^n: Journal of Optimization Theory and Applications, 39, 363--377.

    Version:
    2009.06.09
    Author:
    Dave Hale, Colorado School of Mines

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LasserreVolume(int n)
      Constructs an initially unbounded (infinite) volume in n dimensions.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addHalfSpace(double[] a, double b)
      Adds an nD half-space a1*x1 + a2*x2 + … + an*xn <= b.
      void addHalfSpace(double a1, double b)
      Adds a 1D half-space a1*x1 <= b to bound this volume.
      void addHalfSpace(double a1, double a2, double b)
      Adds a 2D half-space a1*x1 + a2*x2 <= b to bound this volume.
      void addHalfSpace(double a1, double a2, double a3, double b)
      Adds a 3D half-space a1*x1 + a2*x2 + a3*x3 <= b to bound this volume.
      void clear()
      Removes all half-spaces for this volume, making it infinite.

      Gets this volume.

    • Method Detail

      • addHalfSpace

        public void addHalfSpace(double a1,
                double b)
        Adds a 1D half-space a1*x1 <= b to bound this volume. Other coefficients a2, a3, ..., an, if any, are assumed to be zero. The dimension of this volume must be at least 2.
        Parameters:
        a1 - the coefficient a1.
        b - the right-hand-side.

      • addHalfSpace

        public void addHalfSpace(double a1,
                double a2,
                double b)
        Adds a 2D half-space a1*x1 + a2*x2 <= b to bound this volume. Other coefficients a3, a4, ..., an, if any, are assumed to be zero. The dimension of this volume must be at least 2.
        Parameters:
        a1 - the coefficient a1.
        a2 - the coefficient a2.
        b - the right-hand-side.

      • addHalfSpace

        public void addHalfSpace(double a1,
                double a2,
                double a3,
                double b)
        Adds a 3D half-space a1*x1 + a2*x2 + a3*x3 <= b to bound this volume. Other coefficients a4, a5, ..., an, if any, are assumed to be zero. The dimension of this volume must be at least 3.
        Parameters:
        a1 - the coefficient a1.
        a2 - the coefficient a2.
        a3 - the coefficient a3.
        b - the right-hand-side.

      • addHalfSpace

        public void addHalfSpace(double[] a,
                double b)
        Adds an nD half-space a1*x1 + a2*x2 + … + an*xn <= b. Any missing coefficients are assumed to be zero.
        Parameters:
        a - array {a1,a2,...,an} of coefficients.
        b - the right-hand-side.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all half-spaces for this volume, making it infinite.

      • getVolume

        public double getVolume()
        Gets this volume.
        Returns:
        the volume; may be infinite.
